content: party pig all in one pattern double stranded by criss wall i had a huge collection of half balls of yarn i really wanted to use them instead of throwing them out so i started crocheting small toys to leave around for people to find they turned out to be so popular i just can t stop making them i know that there are some lovely pig patterns out there already but some of them take quite some time to finish i wanted to create a small series of patterns that take around 30-40 mins to complete and do not involve sewing additional parts onto the work this pattern is similar to my plain all in one pig except we crochet with double stranded yarn and change colours for the tail and the ears notes  try to use the smallest hook you can for this pattern this will help the pig keep its shape  please use your choice of hook size for this pattern based on the yarn thickness but as a guide for two strands of 8ply/dk i use a 4mm-4 5mm hook for 1 strand 8ply/dk & 1 strand 10ply/aran i use a 4 5mm- 5mm for two strands of 10ply/aran i use a 5mm- 5 5mm hook  you can use any combination of yarn sizes with this pattern it is meant to use up all your scrap yarn i usually use a variegated and a plain but i have also used two strands of plain colours and it turns out well  they measure around 12cm long and 8cm high  you will need to keep track of the start and finish of each row in this pattern the feet and ears are placed in certain stitches in the row stitches  chain  single_crochet single_crochet  half_double_crochet half_double_crochet  double_crochet double_crochet  treble_crochet treble_crochet  increase increase  decrease decrease  5 double_crochet bobble a bobble stitch with 5 double_crochet s 6 loops on your hook  picot three chain and slip_stitch into the back of the first chain  front loop work in the front loop stitch only  back loop work in the back loop stitch only criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-party-pig instructions i usually use three colours two plain and one variegate i have written the pattern based on that my party pig also turns out well without changing colours for the ears and the tail again you use which ever colours you choose my colours for this example plain purple for tail and ears plain yellow for body variegate all the way through tail using the purple and variegate complete the tail the variegate is constant all the way through the purple is substituted for yellow in the tail and row 15 only chain 13 slip_stitch in second chain from the hook and single_crochet in every chain
